creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: darkened interior of a kitchen/workshop; two figures work inside: one at LR stokes the fire inside an oven while the other stands over a sink or workbench near a half open window; room contains large pots, a table with a bench, and an elevated surface at L; just behind crouching figure at R is an open doorway looking out onto trees and chickens
marks:
Signature, Title, Marks, and Inscription

left m LLC: [ よし田 ] {Yoshida}; LRC, in pencil: [Hiroshi Y
title: Farm House
